meanings.definition: Acting as a modifier or regulator
meanings.sent1: The modulatory effect of the medication helped improve the patient's condition.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the modulatory properties of the new compound.
meanings.sent3: The modulatory nature of the weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: Her modulatory approach to teaching transformed the classroom into a dynamic learning environment.
meanings.sent5: The modulatory influence of music can change the mood of a room instantly.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to adjust or control
meanings.sent1: The modulatory thermostat kept the room at a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent2: The modulatory skills of the pilot ensured a smooth landing.
meanings.sent3: The modulatory cat seemed to always find the warmest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: His modulatory leadership style guided the team through challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The modulatory function of the brain allows us to adapt to different situations.

meanings.definition: Influencing or affecting in a changing or adaptive manner
meanings.sent1: The modulatory environment of the workplace encouraged creativity among employees.
meanings.sent2: The modulatory nature of technology shapes our daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The modulatory dance performance captivated the audience with its innovative moves.
meanings.sent4: Her modulatory speech inspired the audience to embrace change.
meanings.sent5: The modulatory effect of exercise on the body is well-documented.
